de.nec.nle.siafu.types

Class EasyTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.types.EasyTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Publishable

    public class EasyTime
extends Object
implements Publishable
    EasyTime is a representation of an hour and a minute. It is meant to provide a simpler time object for the simulations, and provides the additional functionality of flattening and rebuilding the object.

    Note that the value of an EasyTime object will always be normalized so that the minutes are in the range 00..59, and the hours are within 00..23.

    Author:
    Miquel Martin

      • isAfter

        Returns:

      • isBefore

        public boolean isBefore(EasyTime t)
        Determines if this instance of EasyTime represents a time before, or equal to the one given in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        t - the time to compare to
        Returns:
        true if this instance represents a time before or at equal to that of t, false otherwise

      • isIn

        public boolean isIn(TimePeriod tp)
        Determines if this instance of EasyTime is in the time period given by the parameter tp. The comparison conisders hour roll over at midnight when the period spans midnight.
        Parameters:
        tp - the TimePeriod to compare to
        Returns:
        true if this instance is after the start of the period, and before or right at the end of the period.

      • shift

        public EasyTime shift(int hours,
             int minutes)
        Change this EasyTime by adding the hours and minutes of the EasyTime in the parameter and this one. Note thatthe hour and minutes can be negative values. Also note that no day is increased or decreased when the time goes before or after midnight.
        Parameters:
        hours - a number (positive or not) of hours to shift
        minutes - a number (positive or not) of minutes to shift
        Returns:
        this EasyTime, after the addition

      • shift

        public EasyTime shift(EasyTime et)
        Change this EasyTime by adding the hours and minutes of the EasyTime in the parameter and this one. Note thatet can contain negative values. Also note that no day is increased or decreased when the time goes before or after midnight.
        Parameters:
        et - an EasyTime object representing the number of hours and minutes to shift
        Returns:
        this EasyTime, after the addition

      • blur

        public EasyTime blur(int blurMinutes)
        Blurs the given EasyTime time by adding or removing a random amount of minutes, between 0 and blurMinutes.
        Parameters:
        blurMinutes - the number of minutes to add (if positive) or remove (if negative)
        Returns:
        this EasyTime, after the blurring
